pp.dorenda.client2.additional

Class UniversalPainterWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • pp.dorenda.client2.additional.UniversalPainterWriter

  • public class UniversalPainterWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    Writes Files that can read by the UniversalPainter later.

      • positions

        public void positions(Geometry geom,
                      int r,
                      int g,
                      int b,
                      int alpha,
                      int radius,
                      java.lang.String text)
        Same as positions(ArrayList<double[]> latlons...), but a JTS gemeomtry holds the positions information. This method accepts the JTS geometries Point and MultiPoint. Note: the Coordinate objects in the Geometry must hold the coordinates in the same way, the appear in the depro database, i.e. coord.x=longitude, coord.y=latitude.
        Parameters:
        geom - geometry
        r - red value (0..255)
        g - green value (0..255)
        b - blue value (0..255)
        alpha - alpha value (0..255)
        radius - marker radius in pixel (if <=0: use default)
        text - text put on each position, may be null

      • line

        public void line(double lat1,
                 double lon1,
                 double lat2,
                 double lon2,
                 int r,
                 int g,
                 int b,
                 int alpha,
                 int mode,
                 int thickness,
                 java.lang.String startflag,
                 java.lang.String midflag,
                 java.lang.String endflag)
        Generates a line of two positions.
        Parameters:
        lat1 - first postion latitude
        lon1 - first postion longitude
        lat2 - second postion latitude
        lon2 - second postion longitude
        mode - mode display mode according to UniversalPainter
        r - red value (0..255)
        g - green value (0..255)
        b - blue value (0..255)
        alpha - alpha value (0..255)
        thickness - line thickness in pixels (if <0: use default)
        startflag - flag and text put on the first position, may be null
        midflag - flag and text put in the middle of the line string, may be null
        endflag - flag and text put on the last position, may be null

      • line

        public void line(java.util.ArrayList<double[]> latlons,
                 int r,
                 int g,
                 int b,
                 int alpha,
                 int mode,
                 int thickness,
                 java.lang.String startflag,
                 java.lang.String midflag,
                 java.lang.String endflag)
        Generates a linestring.
        Parameters:
        latlons - positions [0]: latitude, [1]: longitude
        mode - mode display mode according to UniversalPainter
        r - red value (0..255)
        g - green value (0..255)
        b - blue value (0..255)
        alpha - alpha value (0..255)
        thickness - line thickness in pixels (if <0: use default)
        startflag - flag and text put on the first position, may be null
        midflag - flag and text put in the middle of the line string, may be null
        endflag - flag and text put on the last position, may be null

      • line

        public void line(Geometry geom,
                 int r,
                 int g,
                 int b,
                 int alpha,
                 int mode,
                 int thickness,
                 java.lang.String startflag,
                 java.lang.String midflag,
                 java.lang.String endflag)
        Same as line(ArrayList<double[]> latlons...), but a JTS gemeomtry holds the line string information. This method accepts the JTS geometries LineString and MultiLineString. In the latter case, all lines are displayed with the same configuration (esp. with the same flags). Note: the Coordinate objects in the Geometry must hold the coordinates in the same way, the appear in the depro database, i.e. coord.x=longitude, coord.y=latitude.
        Parameters:
        geom - line geometry
        mode - mode display mode according to UniversalPainter
        r - red value (0..255)
        g - green value (0..255)
        b - blue value (0..255)
        alpha - alpha value (0..255)
        thickness - line thickness in pixels (if <0: use default)
        startflag - flag and text put on the first position, may be null
        midflag - flag and text put in the middle of the line string, may be null
        endflag - flag and text put on the last position, may be null

      • polygon

        public void polygon(java.util.ArrayList<double[]> latlons,
                    int r,
                    int g,
                    int b,
                    int alpha)
        Generates a polygon.
        Parameters:
        latlons - positions [0]: latitude, [1]: longitude
        r - red value (0..255)
        g - green value (0..255)
        b - blue value (0..255)
        alpha - alpha value (0..255)

      • polygon

        public void polygon(Geometry geom,
                    int r,
                    int g,
                    int b,
                    int alpha)
        Same as polygon(ArrayList<double[]> latlons...), but a JTS gemeomtry holds the polygon information. This method accepts the JTS geometries Polygon and MultiPolygon. Note: each Polyone must not have a hole (otherwise an execption is issued). This method generates POLYGON entries according to UniversalPainter, that only defines a single shell. In case of MultiPolygon this methods generates multiple POLYGON entries in the output. If the caller is not sure, if holes exist, he should directly call multipolygone(...). Further note: the Coordinate objects in the Geometry must hold the coordinates in the same way, the appear in the depro database, i.e. coord.x=longitude, coord.y=latitude.
        Parameters:
        geom - polygon geometry
        r - red value (0..255)
        g - green value (0..255)
        b - blue value (0..255)
        alpha - alpha value (0..255)

      • multipolygon

        public void multipolygon(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<double[]>> shells,
                         java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<double[]>> holes,
                         int r,
                         int g,
                         int b,
                         int alpha,
                         int thickness)
        Generates a multi-polygon with holes.
        Parameters:
        shells - list of shells, each has positions [0]: latitude, [1]: longitude
        holes - list of holes, each has positions [0]: latitude, [1]: longitude
        r - red value (0..255)
        g - green value (0..255)
        b - blue value (0..255)
        alpha - alpha value (0..255)
        thickness - thickness

      • multipolygon

        public void multipolygon(Geometry geom,
                         int r,
                         int g,
                         int b,
                         int alpha,
                         int thickness)
        Same as multipolygon(ArrayList<double[]> latlons...), but a JTS gemeomtry holds the polygon information. This method accepts the JTS geometries Polygon and MultiPolygon. Note: the Coordinate objects in the Geometry must hold the coordinates in the same way, the appear in the depro database, i.e. coord.x=longitude, coord.y=latitude.
        Parameters:
        geom - polygon geometry
        r - red value (0..255)
        g - green value (0..255)
        b - blue value (0..255)
        alpha - alpha value (0..255)
        thickness - thickness

      • jtsGeometry

        public void jtsGeometry(Geometry geom,
                        int r,
                        int g,
                        int b,
                        int alpha,
                        int lineMode,
                        int lineThickness,
                        int pointRadius)
        Generate a JTS geometry, whatever it is. This method can process Polygon, Multipolygon, LineString, MultiLineString, Point, MultiPoint, GeometryCollection
        Parameters:
        geom - a JTS geometry
        r - red value (0..255)
        g - green value (0..255)
        b - blue value (0..255)
        alpha - alpha value (0..255)
        lineMode - line mode display mode according to UniversalPainter
        lineThickness - line thickness in pixels (if <=0: use default)
        pointRadius - point marker radius in pixel (if <=0: use default)

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the output.
